Description:
Detects when a shell program such as the Windows command prompt or PowerShell is launched with system privileges from a uncommon parent location.

Author: frack113, Tim Shelton (update fp)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Elevated System Shell Spawned From Uncommon Parent Location
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where ((((process_path like '%\powershell.exe' or process_path like '%\pwsh.exe' or process_path like '%\cmd.exe') and (original_file_name = 'powershell.exe' or original_file_name = 'pwsh.dll' or original_file_name = 'cmd.exe')) and ((username like '%authori%' or username like '%autori%') and logon_id = '0x3e7')) and  not ((parent_process_path like '%:\program files (x86)\%' or parent_process_path like '%:\program files\%' or parent_process_path like '%:\programdata\%' or parent_process_path like '%:\windows\system32\%' or parent_process_path like '%:\windows\syswow64\%' or parent_process_path like '%:\windows\temp\%' or parent_process_path like '%:\windows\winsxs\%') or parent_process_path = 'null' or parent_process_path = '') and  not ((parent_process_path like '%:\manageengine\admanager plus\pgsql\bin\postgres.exe' and process_path like '%\cmd.exe') or (command like '%:\windows\system32\cmd.exe /c "%' and current_directory like '%:\windows\temp\asgard2-agent\%') or (parent_process_path like '%:\ibm\spectrumprotect\webserver\scripts\%' and command like '%:\ibm\spectrumprotect\webserver\scripts\%')))
